title: Oregon National Historic Trail: NPS Centennial
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     NPS Centennial            NPS Centennial       Centennial Events on the Oregon Trail  Bridging the Community: Powder Mill Bridge Dedication  June 9th, 2016, 10:00 am; Kansas City, Missouri  Come view the formal dedication of the newly erected Powder Mill Bridge. More information... Oregon Trail Trek October 16th, 2016; Alcove Spring Park, Blue Rapids, Kansas All ages are invited to retrace the route of the Oregon and California National Historic Trails by participating in a run/walk. More information...      The National Park Service turns 100 on August 25, 2016. As we lead up to the centennial, we invite you to participate in Find Your Park Experiences to learn, discover, be inspired, or simply have fun in national parks. Find Your Park Experiences offer unique opportunities to explore national parks both in person and online. Check out the experiences in this park or search all experiences to identify an opportunity that matches your interests. You can also share your national park story at FindYourPark.com. A Call to Action remains the foundation for our 2016 centennial preparations. It is the National Park Service's blueprint for the future, outlining the innovative work we want to accomplish. Oregon National Historic Trail is a big part of this effort. Take a look at what we're doing and get involved!   Experiences      Circle of Discovery  Circle of Discovery parks of northern California and southern Oregon include Redwood National and State Parks, Oregon Caves National Monument and Preserve, Crater Lake National Park, Lava Beds National Monument, Tule Lake Unit, Lassen Volcanic National Park, and Whiskeytown National Recreation Area. Read more   Don't Get Stuck in a Rut  Visit the Guernsey Ruts of Wyoming to experience five-foot deep ruts cut by thousands of wheels of pioneer wagons. Read more      Call to Action Projects    Learn more about the work we're doing to prepare for the future.
